Trial_Design.evidence: In this double-blind randomized controlled trial, 120 consecutive primary noncemented THAs in 120 patients were assigned to one of two groups (MIS or CLASS).

Participants.evidence: 120 consecutive primary noncemented THAs in 120 patients

Intervention.evidence: assigned to one of two groups (MIS or CLASS)

Objective.evidence: Does minimally invasive hip arthroplasty result in superior clinical outcomes?

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary end point was the Harris hip score (HHS) at 6 weeks postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The randomization sequence was stratified for two groups of surgeons

Blinding.evidence: In this double-blind randomized controlled trial

Number_Randomised.evidence: 120 consecutive primary noncemented THAs in 120 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: statistically significant increased mean HHSs were seen compared with the CLASS group at 6 weeks and 1 year

Harms.evidence: Although not statistically significant, the perioperative complication rate was rather high in the (anterolateral) MIS group.
